title: 'Concerning' rise in pre-teens self-injuring
description: The rate of hospital admissions for nine to 12-year-olds who self-injure has doubled in six years.

title: 'Disturbing' hallucinations increase during lockdown for blind people
description: Lockdown sees a "disturbing" rise in the number of blind people experiencing distressing hallucinations, a charity says.

title: Covid-19: PM urges 'optimistic but patient approach' to pandemic
description: Boris Johnson hails the success of the vaccine rollout but says we must keep our "foot to the floor".

title: Covid in Scotland: Sturgeon set to confirm phased return to schools
description: The first minister says she is "very keen" to see a return to more normal schooling for some pupils.

title: Covid-19: Millions of asthmatics 'must wait for vaccine'
description: A much narrower group will now be eligible than previously indicated.

title: Covid-19: Vaccine as good in 'real world' as in trial in Israel
description: The Pfizer vaccine prevented 94% of infections in a group of 600,000 Israeli patients.

title: Covid: 'No evidence' schools spread lots of coronavirus
description: Researchers looked at teacher and pupil Covid "sick days" in England in the autumn term up to Christmas.

title: Covid: Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine to be tested on children
description: A trial will assess whether the vaccine produces a strong immune response in six to 17-year-olds.

title: Covid: Third of social care staff still not vaccinated, Matt Hancock says
description: The health secretary confirms a jab has been offered to everyone in the UK's top four priority groups.

title: How has coronavirus affected mental health?

title: Life on the Covid front line as a hospital porter
description: Newsbeat's been given access to the front line of the pandemic at Harrogate District Hospital.

title: Covid variants: What are they and will vaccines work?’
description: The UK is stepping up testing to find and stop cases from spreading in the community.

description: The government hopes "surge" testing will reduce transmission of a new variant of Covid-19.

title: Covid: What is the government doing about the South Africa variant?
description: The new strain was reported in South Africa on 18 December.

title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?

description: Why experts are concerned about the emergence of this particular new version of coronavirus.

description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

description: There’s a lot of choice about which type of face covering to wear – and in some countries the advice is changing.

title: Matt Hancock: 'Third of social care staff' still not vaccinated
description: The health secretary urges people to come forward to get their first coronavirus vaccine dose.

title: Covid infecting humans through animal host 'probable'
description: Professor John Watson is a member of the World Health Organization's team investigating the origins of Covid-19.

title: The NHS vaccination bus providing easier access to Covid jabs
description: Take a look inside a NHS mobile service that aims to boost uptake of the Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson 'optimistic' over easing of restrictions
description: Boris Johnson says he will set out "as much detail" as he can give, in his lockdown roadmap on 22 February.
